intro: Phaeosphaerion pseudomonosperma, commonly known as the black-capped starwort, is a rare and unusual member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped inflorescence and dark purple to black stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically sensitive species.
